top_comment.author: nick stark

comments.text:
But, where in a science book do it talk about the very beginning of Earth, 
or any planet anywhere for that matter? Where in a science book does it 
list the origins of how the universe first started, not the "dot" in the 
center of the universe (if you believe in the "Big Bang Theory") but the 
matter that makes up that "dot," where all that material was created from. 
I have talked to a couple of different atheists before and they can't 
explain the origins of how the first speck of matter came to be. If you can 
find that anywhere, written down or evidenced (not sure if that is a word, 
but it is now), I will be amazed. Until then, you have no way to prove that 
creationism does not exist. And furthermore, as a side note, I support 
science and things people have done and will do with science, I just cannot 
see why people are so intent on cracking down against religion nowadays.
comments.author: roblepk dragonslayer

comments.text:
+roblepk dragonslayer Because we should teach science in the science class 
room.  Because we should educate - not indoctrinate.  And there is a huge 
difference between an informed and evidence based opinion vs. willful 
ignorance.  We do not teach things like alchemy or astrology or flat 
earth-ism . . . nor should we teach creationism.
It is true that some people believe in these things but it is not the job 
of educators to waste their time teaching ignorance or ad hoc.  Rather, it 
is the job of science teachers to teach science.  And creationism is not 
science.

top_comment.author: Global Warming Skeptic

comments.text:
+6chhelipilot In order to better help you understand what gnosticism and 
agnosticism is, let me present it to you in the form of a spectrum.

Let's say we have a knowledge spectrum
0% knowledge means you know nothing.
100% means you are certain.

HOW YOU DEFINE AGNOSTICISM:
Anything from 0% to 99.999...% knowledge, to you, is an agnostic.

HOW AGNOSTICISM IS ACTUALLY DEFINED:
0% and ONLY 0% certainty.  Bottom line:  you don't have a clue whether God 
exists or not in order to be a theist or an atheist.

0% is what babies have when they are born.  They have no background 
information on the existence or nonexistence of God, and thus cannot 
express a belief.  

Put simply:  You cannot have a position on something (theism or atheism) 
that you have knowledge that contributes to acceptance, or rejection
comments.author: Global Warming Skeptic

comments.text:
+Justus McNeal

Again, Wikipedia is not a relevant source

Now you're just being idiotic.

What sources do you have to claim your assertion to be correct?

"The mistake that your links make is that they assumes "Atheist" is defined 
as someone who "Doesn't believe in God(s).""

You can't group all atheists together and claim that they all have the same 
ideas about atheism.

In its broadest definition, Atheism is someone who doesn't believe in 
Gods. Theism is someone who believes in Gods. They both address the 
position on belief.

 Do *all* 'theists' claim to 'know' that a God actually exists?

Do *all* 'atheists' claim to know that Gods do not actually exist?

No, they don't all claim that. So is it fair to group them all together?

No, it's not.
comments.author: 6chhelipilot

comments.text:
+6chhelipilot 
Again, Wikipedia is not a relevant source, so I'll deal with your other 
links.


The mistake that your links make is that they assumes "Atheist" is defined 
as someone who "Doesn't believe in God(s)." 

Again, atheism is the rejection of theistic claims.  Atheism is NOT 
synonymous with non-theism.

In order to reject claims of theists, you forfeit your agnostic position.

Same with the other blogs and atheist websites you cited.
comments.author: Global Warming Skeptic

comments.text: +6chhelipilot Yup, sure is hard to wrap ones head around. x)

It's really the difference between knowledge claims and belief claims that

Atheism and Theism go towards what you believe.
comments.author: 6chhelipilot

comments.text:
+Justus McNeal I see you dont know what atheism and agnosticism really 
is... Go back and study it some more and then return tyvm.
comments.author: Andreas karlsson

comments.text:
+Justus McNeal

You are factually and philosophically wrong.

You have completely ignored the evidence that I have provided, but this 
comes as no surprise.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gnosticism

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agnosticism

Agnosticism means: I claim to KNOW this to be:

 UNKNOWABLE or UNKNOWN to me.

Gnosticism means: I claim to KNOW this to be:

 KNOWABLE or KNOWN to me.

You will notice the contrast between those who claim to know and those who 
claim that it's unknowable. Or, at least you would if you have read the 
links.

Also:

http://actok.org/faqs/whats-the-difference-between-an-atheist-and-an-agnostic/

http://www.atheistnexus.org/profiles/blogs/you-are-agnostic?xg_source=activity

http://www.thinkatheist.com/photo/agnosticgnosticatheisttheist-1?context=user

http://unreligiousright.blogspot.co.uk/2011/10/simple-chart-of-belief-non-belief.html

http://media.tumblr.com/tumblr_liwdu45h521qe3nnq.jpg

But I suppose that they could all be lying?

"An agnostic cannot reject anything because the agnostic has no knowledge 
to use to defend his rejection."

Who actually has KNOWledge to truly claim to BELIEVE that a God exists?

Anyone? You? A gnostic theist?

The agnostic is claiming that it is not possible to claim knowledge about 
Gods. They are not claiming to not know about Gods.

This is philosophy 101 FFS!

You may also wish to read this:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epistemology
comments.author: 6chhelipilot

comments.text:
+6chhelipilot You can't have belief on something that you have no knowledge 
of, that's the contradiction.

Atheists know enough to reject theistic claims.  This is a point of 
knowledge that PREVENTS atheists from also being agnostics.

You can't claim to both have knowledge and lack all knowledge on a subject 
at the same time.  Again, agnosticism is the complete absence of a position.

*Gnosticism versus agnosticism*

Agnosticism means the complete absence of knowledge.  Gnosticism means 
complete and certain knowledge.  Not being a gnostic doesn't mean being an 
agnostic.  Again, they are both absolute ends to the knowledge spectrum.

*Agnostic atheists reject?*

An agnostic cannot reject anything because the agnostic has no knowledge to 
use to defend his rejection.  Saying something like "There's no evidence" 
is a point of knowledge that prevents the claim of agnosticism.
comments.author: Global Warming Skeptic

comments.text:
+Justus McNeal

"The problem with the term "Agnostic Atheist" is that it is a 
contradiction."

Why?

Atheistic, in that they don't believe in deities. Agnostic, in that they 
don't think that knowledge is known about or can be known about deities.

"An agnostic is a person who has no position on a particular idea.  An 
agnostic as it pertains to religion is someone with no position on the 
existence of God.  The agnostic neither supports nor rejects any idea of 
God's existence."

Agnosticism tells you what someone claims to 'KNOW' about deities. That's 
the 'KNOWLEDGE' part. It does not tell you what they 'BELIEVE' about 
deities. That's where the 'ATHEISM' and 'THEISM' part comes in. The 
'BELIEF' part.

Gnosticism means 'knowledge'. Agnosticism means 'without knowledge'.

Agnosticism goes to what you claim to KNOW about deities. And Atheism and 
Theism go to what you claim to BELIEVE about deities.

Agnostic atheist = Someone who does not 'believe' in Gods, and does 'not 
know' about Gods.

I hope that's clear?

P.S. I'm not shouting, I'm just trying to be clear about this. :)

The agnostics beliefs are two fold. Firstly, there is the 'belief' or 
'non-belief' in a deity. The 'pure' agnostic, such as myself, has no 
belief, one way or the other, about the existence of deities. The atheistic 
agnostic 'disbelieves' in deities. The theistic agnostic 'believes' in 
deities. That's the 'belief' part dealt with. And secondly, all three agree 
that no knowledge is known or can be known about deities. That's the 
'knowledge' or agnostic part dealt with.

"The Atheist, however, rejects claims of God's existence."

Generally speaking, the atheist rejects 'belief' in deities, as does the 
agnostic atheist. The difference being that one is open to evidence for 
deities, whereas the other claims that knowledge of deities is currently 
unknown and is, in fact, unknowable.  

"Atheists do have a position on the existence of God when they reject 
claims."

Yes, they reject the claims, and the evidence presented, by theists as 
insufficient for belief in a God or Gods.

There is more to atheism, theism, and agnosticism than you think there is. 
It's certainly not a black or white issue. Then you have anti-theism, 
irreligion, and anti-religion, etc, to deal with. Not to mention fideism, 
deism, etc.
comments.author: 6chhelipilot

comments.text:
+6chhelipilot The problem with the term "Agnostic Atheist" is that it is a 
contradiction.

An agnostic is a person who has no position on a particular idea.  An 
agnostic as it pertains to religion is someone with no position on the 
existence of God.  The agnostic neither supports nor rejects any idea of 
God's existence.

Now, "Knowledge" as it pertains to agnosticism is completely void. 
 Agnosticism does not mean "We can never know for sure."  it means "We can 
never know anything."  It is a complete position of neutrality.

The Atheist, however, rejects claims of God's existence. Atheists do have a 
position on the existence of God when they reject claims.
comments.author: Global Warming Skeptic

comments.text:
+Justus McNeal

"Wikipedia is not a relevant source.  If you want to provide sources, use 
reputable sources."

What would you suggest as "reputable sources"?

You're basically denying the existence of agnostic atheism and agnostic 
theism, because you doubt the sources I provided aren't even just a little 
bit reliable? Well, good luck with that, because you would be factually 
wrong.

"Agnostic atheists are atheistic because they do not hold a belief in the 
existence of any deity and agnostic because they claim that the existence 
of a deity is either unknowable in principle or currently unknown in fact."

A 'pure' atheist wouldn't claim that it's not possible to know about the 
existence of a deity.

"An agnostic theist believes in the existence of at least one deity, but 
regards the basis of this proposition as unknown or inherently unknowable."

A 'pure' theist wouldn't claim that it's not possible to know about the 
existence of a deity.

"Agnosticism is the view that the truth values of certain claims—especially 
claims about the existence or non-existence of God, as well as other 
religious and metaphysical claims—are unknown or unknowable."

A 'pure' agnostic does make the claim that the existence of a deity is not 
currently known about and cannot be known. And if you're like me (strong 
agnostic), you would also claim that the existence of deities cannot be 
known by anyone.

That's the difference. 

We could also mention apathetic agnosticism: The claim that belief and 
knowledge values about deities make no difference to the reality that we 
experience.
comments.author: 6chhelipilot

soft and trust me this is not going to last forever.﻿
top_comment.author: Steve Maden

comments.text:
I just assumed, I guess because you kept using the phrase "Your God." I 
just figured, if you were religious, that would make him your God as well, 
correct? I have an Atheist friend who uses the term "your God" all the time 
(supposing that God can't exist for anyone but the religious, when, in 
fact, I actually do believe he can and is...) I just figure that it is out 
of my hands to decide who is "saved" and who isn't in this world, because 
God chooses that....as far as for questions being attacks (or vice-versa), 
they aren't attacks at all, it just seemed like you were bashing religion 
saying "why bother with what you perceive when "your God" knows what will 
happen all along?"
As you have noticed, I am not a fan of anyone bashing religion because I 
believe any religion is sacred and should not be bashed. It is a personal 
thing, in my opinion.
comments.author: roblepk dragonslayer

comments.text:
+roblepk dragonslayer
You response leaves me with so many questions and requests; I hardly know 
where to begin.  First but not necessarily most; regarding your statement: 
 “quit attacking the religious with the statement "while we should be 
relaxed because God knows everything".”: Please help me find in my comment, 
my statement you claim I made.  I cannot seem to locate it.  Also how do 
you consider a question to anyone, an attack?  Are questions suddenly, 
considered attacks?  If so, then what would be the PC method of gaining 
info?  Moreover; are you assuming I’m not religious?
comments.author: timealwaystells

comments.text:
+timealwaystells
 Sorry, but this is the dumbest answer anyone can use to go up against a 
religious person...So, since your God has known all along, you should be 
calm and relaxed that crazy stuff is happening that nobody cares enough to 
stop..." First and foremost, come on, quit attacking the religious with the 
statement "while we should be relaxed because God knows everything". It is 
an insult to anyone religious because God does not speak directly to any 
Christian, we pray to him to get forgiven and we pray to him with questions 
and answers about stuff, but we are also normal people as well...As far as 
us calming down: Dude, crazy stuff is happening, everyone knows that. But 
do enough people care enough to do anything about it? NO! Everybody just 
figures this will all fade away. Second, if things keep going the way they 
are, many people down the line will be loaded with a tremendous debt (17 
trillion and counting that our Government has loaded us with for the 
future), sounds fun huh? This will all have to be paid back and by the time 
Obama is out of office in 2016, this number may be upwards to 18 or 19, 
maybe even bordering on 20 trillion....yes, statistics for anyone who 
cares... So to answer the question...People who understand this can prepare 
for this, or just figure nothing will happen, but eventually it will all 
hit the fan, trust me, if this debt does not get repaid like ASAP!!!
comments.author: roblepk dragonslayer

Science, logic and reason have taken us farther than religious faith ever 
has.﻿

comments.text:
You cannot believe and disbelieve in any gods. You either disbelieve every 
god you've herd of or you believe in at least one. There is no middle 
ground, the closest to that is a deist which believes a god created 
existence but is either gone now or has no ability to intervene in

comments.author: selsuru

comments.text:
Wikipedia:

"Agnosticism is the view that the truth values of certain claims—especially 
claims about the existence or non-existence of any deity, as well as other 
religious and metaphysical claims—are unknown or unknowable.[1][2][3] 
According to the philosopher William L. Rowe, in the popular sense, an 
agnostic is someone who neither believes nor disbelieves in the existence 
of a deity or deities, whereas a theist and an atheist believe and 
disbelieve, respectively."

In other words: The philosophically held positions of atheist and theist 
have no relevance. Agnostics neither believe nor disbelieve in Gods. It's 
also the position that I personally hold.

comments.text:
Note that the 'The tides go in, the tides go out' 'argument' is actually 
one of the innumerable manifestations of the god-of-the-gaps (GOTG) 
argument. When you look at theism-based rhetoric with an eye out for it, it 
truly is amazing how often the GOTG premise manifests itself in one form or 
another. What is it about the human mind that so many people actually take 
that premise seriously?

I don't care, for this is a free country. United States of America. This 
land is for all people, despite if their religious or not. I'm a Christian 
and my love toward Jesus Christ as my savior is overwhelming high, and I 
don't care what other people think, for this is a free country. I don't 
care if you want all of the United States or the whole world to go against 
God, but know this they're people out there like me who'll lay down our 
life. Not for a country of this world, but for our true faith and love 
toward Christianity. Honestly, I don't put my faith unto anyone else. I'm 
just giving you a message that I'll hold my believe even if it costs my 
life. I'm proud to say I'm a Christian and I'll never deny my true faith, 
even if the whole world is against me. I'm a Christian and I love Jesus 
Christ more than anything in the world. ﻿
